title: Medical Simulation-Based Professional Language Communication Competency Enhancement Training

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge (medical terminology, clinical protocols, etc.) and extensive practical experience, basic ability to compose and interpret medical documents, and understanding of specialized vocabulary and grammatical structures
context.additional_context: Cultivating practical communication skills in medical contexts through language simulation in smartphone-centric environments. Emphasizes language use close to real clinical settings via **integrated speaking/listening in virtual patient consultations**, **text structuring/lexical selection in electronic medical records**, and **role-specific expressions/technical terminology in multidisciplinary team scenarios**. Includes evaluations of grammatical accuracy, lexical appropriateness, and communicative effectiveness

learning_goals: In patient-healthcare role-playing based on medical scenarios, learners perform with ≥80% accuracy using **specialized terminology** (medical terms, abbreviations) and communication strategies.
Learners achieve ≥70% accuracy in using specialized terms contextually when documenting and interpreting medical records, cultivating structured text organization skills.

In emergency simulations, learners apply ≥3 appropriate language strategies (e.g., patient status explanation, instruction delivery, collaboration requests) and utilize situational expression strategies (clarity, conciseness, empathetic language).

In team-based virtual clinical simulations, learners apply the **SBAR communication protocol** to develop communication plans for three clinical scenarios (emergency, chronic care, interdisciplinary consultation), achieving ≥4/5 average in peer reviews (2+ out of 3 peers) and simulation rubrics. This includes applying a 3-step structure (subjective-objective-request) in patient reporting, using ≥5 specialized terms in treatment planning, and clearly expressing role divisions (responsibilities, task sequences) in interdisciplinary collaboration.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)
